1121.content:
"Sabrina Spellman!" she hears from behind, prompting her to turn around and look behind her.
"Well, if it isn't my little aunts," Sabrina sneers at the two women behind her.
"Listen, lady," Zelda says. "You need to come down right now!"
"Oh, yeah?" Sabrina taunts. "And what do you plan on doing to stop me?"
"Are you really that naive?" Hilda asks.
"I dare you to do your worst," Sabrina says. "Only I can undo this, and I have no plans to do so."
"Watch us," Hilda says as she and Zelda point their fingers at her. Magic does come out of them, but it refuses to wrap around Sabrina. Sabrina then puts her hands on her hips and laughs maniacally.
"I told you that only I can do anything about this," she says. "Now, I want to show you what I can do now that I'm up here."

12111.content:
Before Sabrina left that morning:

Hilda enters the kitchen ready to make some breakfast for herself. She finds an enraged Zelda ready to skin Salem. A few weeks previously he had stayed up all night watching an Addams Family marathon. All of the episodes had featured Cousin Itt (the walking tower of hair). Finally falling asleep after seeing all of that hair had started giving Salem nightmares. In his sleep he starts trying to cough up imaginary hairballs. When he wakes up from the coughing he raids the refrigerator. A couple of days ago, Zelda had bought nearly 2 1/2 pounds of sushi that cost $25./oz. She has purchased it for a special dinner party she was throwing the next night. Except that sometime during the night, Salem had found and devoured nearly all of it. It doesn't take Zelda long to find Salem asleep on the couch still reeking of tuna. Just as goes to zap him Hilda asks her, "Do you really want to do that?" Zelda replies, "Of course I do, unless you have a better suggestion." Hilda says she does and going back to the kitchen tells Zelda. With a very big grin on her face Zelda agrees that Hilda has a better idea for dealing with that fat cat. Quietly attending to the arrangements in the kitchen the 2 Aunts leave through the back door without disturbing the dear.

A little while later:

Sabrina came downstairs to grab something for breakfast and make her lunch. Smelling Salem in the living room Sabrina leaves by the front door slamming it. Being wakened by Sabrina, Salem seeing how late it is jumps to the floor going to the kitchen. He expects to find his usual food in his dinner bowl. He's not happy to find only 1 large piece of week-old bread and water waiting for him. Incensed at this snub by the Aunts he then says out loud (to no-one) "If they think I'm going to stand for only having bread and water all day they don't know this cat!" Continuing on he says, "If I hurry I can mooch something tasty from Mrs. Simpleton down the street." Speeding up to leap out the cat door in the kitchen door Salem nearly knocks himself out when it doesn't open like it usually would. Grumbling he says, "Gee, maybe those old witches do know this cat." Standing at the back door for a couple of minutes plotting his next move, Salem hears someone getting out their keys at the front door. He then hears Sabrina's voice with some others. Taking off at full speed for the front door, it opens just as he rounds the corner. Jumping on the throw rug and intending to ride it to the front door Salem sees all that hair coming in. He doesn't jump off the rug before sliding into the middle of the girls.

They all deny it and ask where is Salem at? Sabrina is at a loss for that answer. She then says, "since we're stuck here all day I'll look in the refrigerator to see what we can have for lunch. Seeing no other escape Salem runs for the couch jumps on it and successfully leaps for a ceiling lamp, crying up a storm. When Sabrina grabs the remote to turn the tv off nothing happens. Every channel is the same and it WON"T turn off. Now realizing that the Aunts are behind all of this Sabrina is stumped on what to tell the others.

Sabrina hopes that the spell wears off before the either of her Aunts return from work that afternoon. She also starts worrying about what other booby traps they've left around the house to punish Salem. She figures that he must of been a VERY bad kitty for them to go to this much effort. And with the other girls still in her house she can't ask him about that. For now, Sabrina is in as much of a pickle as Salem.

121211.content:
When the Aunts had purchased the house they put a special spell on the property
borders to protect their privacy. That way unless someone was actually standing in
their yard they would not see any magical changes that had occurred. So although
their house was still a pile of rubble, none of the neighbors noticed. Zelda decided
they would repair it after breakfast. So, while Sabrina's breakfast was cooking Libby,
her arch-nemesis, had decided to pull a prank on Sabrina that morning. When she
walked up their sidewalk to the front door she saw the rubble and Sabrina. Sabrina
saw her a fraction of a second before Libby noticed her. Feeling quite mischievous
when Libby asked Sabrina what has happened to her, Sabrina replies, " Thank you
Libby, if you hated me any more than you do I would've grown even taller than this.
This is tall enough for now. Maybe when basketball season comes around in this
fall, you can hate me more so that I can grow even taller.

Libby is frozen to ground at that. To seal the deal Sabrina then asks Libby to wait
around for a few minutes. Libby asks," Why should I?" Sabrina then says, "Once
I finish breakfast we can go to school together. I'll even give you a ride." Smiling now
Libby says, "Sabrina, didn't I hear at school yesterday that one of your Aunts had
taken your car away for 2 weeks?" "Your right, Libby my Aunt Zelda did take away

of a better way for you to ride to school." Sabrina said with a very, big smile. Libby

how would I ride to school if not in your car?" Pointing to her boobs Sabrina says,
"Why in here of course, Libby. Don't worry I'll tie you real tight into my bra. There'll
be no chance of you falling out. Then again, I can't guarantee how smooth the ride
will be. When the weather is nice like today, sometimes I jog to school taking the
